subject: RE: [junit] If a test fails (on an error), is tearDown called any way?
msgSnippet: ... uh, wouldn t that be tearDown() is always called iff setUp() doesn t throw up something? -- Chester Kustarz 2 http://www.monkey.org/~chester
messageBody:
On Tue, 23 Oct 2001, Di Iorio, Matthew (ISS Atlanta) wrote:
> Yes, in my experience, tearDown is always called. From the JUnit code:
>
> class TestCase {
> ...
> public void runBare() throws Throwable {
> setUp();
> try {
> runTest();
> }
> finally {
> tearDown();
> }
> }

uh, wouldn't that be tearDown() is always called iff setUp() doesn't throw
up something?

--
Chester Kustarz 2
http://www.monkey.org/~chester
